posts.name: Kyle
posts.cooked:
Add message effects like apple iMessage.
Fireworks,spotlight,balloons,confetti and message effect on messages slam, invisible ink,Gentle and loud.

posts.name: Gravy Pouch
posts.cooked: This should be under the feature request category, Not ios support.
I‚Äôve used these maybe 5 times. Personally don‚Äôt see the point.

The point will be to communicate emotions and actions. Sometimes without needing to say a word. Sometimes, to add more substance or context, to some message already written. It helps you be more expressive and makes messaging more fun and joyfull.

It has the same reasoning as GIFs, emojis, reactions, etc. Makes the conversation richer.

I would love such a feature.

Actually I will say it. I guess I will love iMessage UX/UI with Signal backend.
Actually I don‚Äôt need these kind of effects BUT for reaction emojis: it would be nice if reaction cast was animated like on Messenger when it is applied.

posts.name: Drashya
posts.cooked:
I love the message effects that we see on iMessage (Use message effects with iMessage on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch - Apple Support) - they are fun to use and bring a kick to all the emojis and stickers that we see on chats.

Plus, (and I am not sure why) they are something neither of Signal competitors have (WhatsApp/Telegram) - so it would be something of unique added benefit. Of course, it might just be the case that these effects are super difficult to implement/maintain - so that might be a reason to not implement them - but it would be awesome in any case.

Thanks!!

link_counts.title: Use message effects with iMessage on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch - Apple Support

posts.edit_reason: Has been requested indeed. I moved your post, so there's no need for that clarification :)

posts.name: Drashya
posts.cooked: I used them ALL the time! They‚Äôre quite fun.

posts.name: Tim
posts.cooked:
This is literally one of the main things that has me send birthday messages in iMessage for my iOS contacts (even though they don‚Äòt use iMessage): for the birthday balloons effect text.

Would love if Signal added something like the iMessage effects. Not necessarily the fullscreen ones but the bubble effects (invisible ink for e.g. spoilery texts or a slam effect to make a point stand out).
Ya like when you send someone a happy birthday message and confetti comes from the top‚Ä¶super nice

These are the kind of features that made iMessage as popular as it is, and one of the primary reasons why some people still buy iphones.

I can understand that some users just want a simple and ‚Äúboring‚Äù text messaging app, but in this day and age, the average user expects so much more than just plain old IRC-style text-messages.

Implementing more fun stuff like this could help boost the popularity of Signal even further and i would love to see signal kick all the other messaging apps in the butt!

A messaging app these days has to be much more that just text, audio and video calls.

Let‚Äôs make Signal be the reason why people leave iMessage!

A good summary and short history of why Apple did the right move when focusing so heavily an making iMessage more fun

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uUqHX4uYs_k

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LucwfmIt7vU

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
morpheus:

These are the kind of features that made iMessage as popular as it is

Never mind the vendor lock-in and the fact you can‚Äôt choose an alternative default messaging app on iOS‚Ä¶

morpheus:

the average user expects so much more than just plain old IRC-style text-messages.

The average cell phone/computer user has no idea what IRC is, and probably can‚Äôt tell you the difference between iMessages and SMS other than the color of the bubble.

morpheus:

Implementing more fun stuff like this could help boost the popularity of Signal even further and i would love to see signal kick all the other messaging apps in the butt!

As long as they don‚Äôt compromise privacy/security, I agree.

drashya:

Plus, (and I am not sure why) they are something neither of Signal competitors have (WhatsApp/Telegram)

add telegram to the list of ‚Äúhaves‚Äù as of a couple months ago

Telegram ‚Äì 19 Sep 21

Chat Themes, Interactive Emoji, Read Receipts in Groups and Live Stream...

Today's update lets you set different themes for individual chats, share your feelings with loved ones using interactive emoji with fullscreen effects, record video and audio from live broadcasts, and see detailed read receipts in groups.

With a little code, a little drawing and a lot of dark magic, we‚Äôve created a new way of sharing emotion in real time. Send a single or to any private chat, then tap on the animated emoji to unleash a fullscreen effect.

If both you and your chat partner have the chat open, the animations and vibrations play simultaneously on your devices, so you feel close even when you‚Äôre far apart.

posts.name: Nh916
posts.cooked: It would be great to have animated message effects‚Äîlike balloons or confetti‚Äîthat trigger when certain keywords (e.g., ‚Äúhappy birthday‚Äù) are detected. This would add a fun, engaging layer to messaging. With a more engaging and entertaining interface, Signal could appeal to a broader audience, encouraging users to make it their default messaging app and potentially driving wider adoption.
